description: We need you! ABN AMRO is a leading Dutch bank, with an international presence across Europe, Asia Pacific, and the Americas. We are looking for skilled junior quantitative risk analysts who have a solid quantitative background and a passion for working with advanced techniques to unlock the valuable information contained within our production and historical data. Your job As a Non-Retail Credit Risk modeller, you will play a key role in ensuring that the bank makes informed, data driven decisions. Your main focus will be the development and maintenance of our Credit Risk models for professional clients covering over EUR 100 billion in exposure. These models are key to the existence of the bank as they form the basis for loan approval, pricing, performance management and regulatory capital.  In your day-to-day job you will work in multidisciplinary project teams. You closely work together with the business lines in order to ensure that the models properly reflect the business and processes. You will decide on the best quantitative methods and techniques to unlock the intelligence contained within the data. You are aware of new and existing regulatory requirements and ensure that these are properly reflected in the models. As a junior analyst you take the responsibility over parts of the model development process and are actively involved in stakeholder management.  Overall you apply your quantitative skills and experience on various data sets and business challenges, and make a positive impact for the bank and its customers. You will contribute significantly to the success of your team, which includes both junior analysts and experienced senior risk analysts who can help you to further develop your skills. About us ABN AMRO Risk Modelling is a growing, international team of more than 90 professionals. We are the centre of excellence within the bank for developing quantitative risk models, which inform the bank in its daily decisions, from pricing of deals and granting of customer credits, through to setting and monitoring of market risk limits and determining the capital requirements for the bank. About you! you have a strong quantitative education in an area such as pure mathematics, econometrics, actuarial studies, or physics. Besides that you have skills in software packages for statistical and data analysis, such as Python, SAS, R, and MATLAB you want to prove yourself in a quantitative modelling environment, and to apply your skills to derive meaningful, robust, data driven models to guide business decisions you work well within a team, and can take responsibility for making your contribution to successful delivery you fit the profile if you meet the following requirements: Quantitative academic education (Master’s Degree or PhD) in a relevant field, like econometrics, mathematics, actuarial studies or physics good knowledge of statistics, econometrics, financial mathematics, stochastic calculus or machine learning able to effectively communicate (in written and spoken English) about your analysis and results; experienced in modern programming languages (e.g. MATLAB, Python) or statistical languages (e.g. SAS, R) strong analytic skills and affinity with data analytics, (pre)processing, and data handling able to work independently and under pressure pro-active attitude and an excellent team player Our offer the opportunity to be the best you can be, work flexible hours and lots of room to grow both personally and professionally an informal multi-cultural working environment with great colleagues challenging work on complex and advanced quantitative problems the opportunity to pro-actively work on your vitality and fitness a competitive salary a supplementary benefit budget of 11%, which you can spend on additional fringe benefits a personal development budget of EUR 1.000 per year an annual public transportation pass or travel budget, depending on the function a solid pension plan Interested? Please submit your application online. We request you to upload your grades with your resume.  We are looking forward to hear from you!

The CRM grid is working on the transformation of the CRM platform in ABN AMRO into a new platform with Microsoft Dynamics. Next to this development the CRM grid will lead the transition for the current integrated application for Clients Assessment on Sustainability (CASY) within the Credits domain into a standalone environment within Grid CRM. As part of a larger team you convert opportunities for CASY into concrete solutions. Work on achieving your goals and develop yourself professionally and personally. Tell us your story. Your job You are end-to-end responsible for the development and implementation of a standalone environment for all corporate clients that will be one data source for sustainability with various functionalities e.g. assess clients during the client journey; maintain sustainability risk adherence; flexible to change and log changes for assurance and internally hosted client dashboards. This environment must be linked to the development of the NextGen CRM platform Microsoft Dynamics, which roll out has started in November 2020. If this standalone environment is established the next stage is a go-to environment for client related data on sustainability as a complete client facing online platform with other functionalities e.g. assess clients on their sustainability performance; fee-based propositions and integration with other processes e.g. KYC.It is your responsibility to control potential risks and pro-actively engage regulations associated with this product and help to translate this into policy and products. You also make sure all product and decision engines are documented and aligned with other departments, like Credit Risk, Legal, Compliance and IT. You give input for strategic advice processes: from problem analysis, identification of solution directions to implementation thereof. Projects have an IT component, in which you team up with engineers to build better products. You formulate and refine the requirements, testing results and supporting implementation. Working environment The CRM Grid wants to create CRM as a Service as a fundamental and essential enabler to secure a continuously evolving future proof ABN AMRO service model. The core purpose is to create an awesome customer and employee experience across all channels, seamlessly through optimal use of data, relevant customer insights must be provided. We work with a team of 60 ambitious colleagues (Business and IT) who share a passion for CRM. In our team we face a new challenge. Sustainability is the strategic pillar for ABN AMRO and carries a bank wide impact. In particular, ABN AMRO must be able to adhere to the sustainability policy for lending. In turn the bank should be able to conduct a strategic dialogue with all our clients and position ourselves as a bank that accelerate the sustainability shift. To support this vital initiative a new platform will be created for Clients Assessment on Sustainability (CASY) to conduct a strategic dialogue with all our clients, (small) lending and credit.  Goals for the platform are: Being able to assess input from our clients and benchmark as per our expectations Being able to provide insight to business for their progress on targets Monitor and follow-up on actions agreed during dialogues Your profile You are an energetic person with a passion for the combination of thinking and doing. Being a business developer in our Grid is a broad function with elements of products, processes and consultancy. At the same time new products must fit together well and meet the future needs and wishes of our customer. We ask you for precision, creativity, empathy and broad knowledge of sustainability. With these competencies you know how to create the best environment for our business and the customer. You present your ideas in a convincing and concise way with impact. You also know how to manage your stakeholders and with your social skills you quickly obtain insight into the various interests within an organization. Do you think you fit in with us?  Check your profile: Hbo/Bachelor level of working and thinking Five or more years’ relevant work experience within an agile work environment Demonstrable experience as a business developer Scrum certifications for scrum master or certificates for business analyst/developer - Specific competencies for this role: -Change orientated, -Analytical, -Client focused, -Entrepreneurial, -Collaborative Interested? Are you interested? Then apply online for this vacancy. For more information, contact Hao Hu, Product Owner CASY at 06-11497899 or Margriet Heijne, Product Owner MSD at 06-22927760. We would like to meet you!  Note: you are in de possession of a Dutch working permit.

De Business Data Analyst bij BMW Group Nederland ontwerpt voorspellende strategische modellen en/of algoritmes op basis waarvan de business haar doelstellingen realiseert. Wil jij het verschil maken als het gaat om het verzamelen, asessen en prepareren van data(sets)? Lees dan eens verder, want deze fulltime baan in Rijswijk kan dan van jou zijn! Mis deze baan niet, solliciteer snel want volgende week vinden de gesprekken al plaats! De functie De Business Data Analyst bij BMW Group Nederland vertaalt de business vraagstukken (zoals salesresultaten, marketingdata over conversie, personalisatie, optimalisatie en forecasting als ook financiële cijfers) naar voorspellende strategische modellen of algoritmes op basis waarvan de business haar doelstellingen realiseert: méér auto’s verkopen tegen de juiste marge. Je bouwt concrete dashboards en modellen met Tableau en Python. Je bent eveneens verantwoordelijk voor de exploitatie van nieuwe datasets en technieken. Kortom: Je voorspelt welke acties de business moet nemen om de verkoopdoelstellingen effectiever en efficiënter te halen. Hiermee verbeter je ook de klantbediening en/of commerciële klant/markt benadering In deze rol maak jij het verschil, als het gaat om het verzamelen, asessen en prepareren van data(sets). Je visualiseert data-inzichten, op basis van hypothesen vanuit de business, als ook op basis van eigen ideeën. Natuurlijk werk je samen met een data-engineer. Je bent ook een Business Consultant die vervolgvragen beantwoordt vanuit de directie en business over de werking en validatie van het resultaat. Je geeft trainingen en technisch/inhoudelijke ondersteuning, met name op het gebied van Tableau. Je bent sparring partner richting Directie Nederland en BMW AG (Duitsland) op het gebied van nieuwe datatechnieken en GPM (granular performance management). Je maakt deel uit van het Market Intelligence Team. Jouw profiel De Business Data Analyst is iemand die vragen stelt, in oplossingen denkt, assertief en integer is. Wij zoeken een gemotiveerde en resultaatgerichte persoonlijkheid die drive en overtuigingskracht heeft. Jouw analytische vaardigheden stellen jouw in staat een visie op de juiste wijze te vertalen en tot uitvoer te brengen. Je krijgt dingen voor elkaar! Je bent in staat om nieuwe inzichten en/of modellen vanuit de beschikbare data statistisch te modelleren. Je communiceert makkelijk in verschillende situaties naar verschillende personen. Het is belangrijk dat je jouw visie goed kunt overbrengen naar stakeholders. Dit doe je op een enthousiaste en overtuigende manier. Natuurlijk stem je dit af op verschillende situaties en gesprekspartners. Jouw enthousiaste werkinstelling werkt aanstekelijk. Hiermee motiveer je ook anderen. Je hebt de gave anderen van jouw ideeën te overtuigen en je behandelt mensen op de manier waarop je zelf behandeld wilt worden. In deze baan is het belangrijk dat je goed onder druk kunt werken. Verder breng je met je mee: HBO+ | WO Werk- en denkniveau; achtergrond in een sterk kwantitatieve richting bijvoorbeeld econometrie, (toegepaste) wiskunde of natuurkunde; Ervaring met Tableau en Python (of vergelijkbaar), statistiek, modelbouw en optimalisatie; Tenminste 2 jaar werkervaring in een vergelijkbare functie; Je hebt kennis van de business domeinen zoals Marketing, Operations of Finance; Je kunt uitstekende communiceren in het Nederlands en Engels in woord en geschrift; Kan je ook Duits dan is dat een voordeel. Bedrijfsprofiel BMW Group Nederland zit middenin een groots modellenoffensief, terwijl ze tegelijkertijd zeer ambitieuze duurzaamheidsdoelstellingen nastreeft. Premium en duurzaamheid zijn immers onafscheidelijk. Het BMW Group portfolio bevat volledig elektrische modellen, vele plug-in hybrides én zeer efficiënte verbrandingsmotoren met de laagst mogelijke CO2-uitstoot. Zo hebben onze klanten zélf de keuze. Deze boeiende mix van vooruitgang en optimisme vindt haar weg richting de wereldwijde markten. Met name de Nederlandse, waar BMW Group Nederland met de merken BMW, MINI en BMW Motorrad al jaren marktleider is in het (premium)segment. Wij zijn een onderdeel van de wereldwijd opererende BMW Group in München en verantwoordelijk voor de verkoop en marketing van BMW, BMW Motorrad en MINI in Nederland. Onze marktpositie wordt verder versterkt door de nauwe samenwerking met het BMW/MINI dealernetwerk en BMW Group dochterondernemingen BMW Financial Services en Alphabet. Binnen de organisatie werken vele specialismen samen aan ambitieuze doelstellingen en processen. Er is een uitstekende samenwerking tussen de teams in een bedrijf waar iedereen de passie deelt voor onze begeerlijke twee- en vierwielers. Het aanbod De Business Data Analyst treedt direct fulltime in dienst bij BMW Group Nederland in Rijswijk. Je kan rekenen op: Salaris tussen €3.500 en €4.500 afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring; 24 vakantiedagen en 6 adv-dagen; Een persoonlijke bonus op basis van behaalde persoonlijke doelstellingen en ontwikkeling; Een company-bonus op basis van behaalde organisatie- en persoonlijke doelstellingen; 8% vakantietoeslag; Een collectieve pensioenregeling (DC regeling); Reiskostenvergoeding; Aantrekkelijke BMW, MINI en BMW Motorrad regelingen. Ben jij de Business Data Analyst die wij zoeken? Wij ontvangen graag jouw CV. Wil je eerst meer informatie? Dat kan: bel over deze vacature met Kasia Lamens, Recruitment Consultant Key Accounts, telefoon 06-25080695.  Het sollicitatieproces Lees meer op onze website over het sollicitatieproces bij Exact. Kennis van RFM / Churn is een pré. Je kunt A/B testen opstellen en uitvoeren. Gelet op onze doelgroep èn zowel in- als externe klanten, is een uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal een vereiste, zowel mondeling als schriftelijk. Het is je missie om de organisatie data gedreven te laten werken. En wat hebben wij jou te bieden? Natuurlijk een mooi arbeidsvoorwaardenpakket, waaronder een salaris dat past bij jouw kennis en ervaring. We zijn een snel groeiende business unit binnen Jongeneel met collega’s die professioneel zijn maar plezier in het werk net zo belangrijk vinden. Er ontstaan regelmatig kansen om je kennis en ambitie vorm te geven. Om een goede balans te houden tussen werk en privé is het belangrijk om af en toe even los te komen van je werk. Daarom krijg je bij een fulltime dienstverband 24 vakantiedagen en 6 ADV-dagen. Vitaliteit vinden wij belangrijk, wij dragen ook graag ons steentje bij om jou die vitaliteit te bieden. Do you like a job with plenty of variety? Are you interested in data, programming, Risk and stakeholder management? Do you want to work in a dynamic and multidisciplinary team, and are you keen to share your knowledge? If so, take a look at the vacancy of Senior Modelling Data Analyst (Credit Risk)!  We are constantly looking for ways to improve we manage our risks. Risk Models play a pivotal role in this. These models rely on accurate data supplied by our Modelling Data Teams as part of ABN AMRO’s Risk Data & Analytics department. We are looking for experienced, fast learning Modelling Data Analysts who like to translate credit risk data requirements to reliable modelling data sets and are eager to contribute making our data collection processes future proof. Your job As a member of the Modelling Data team, you supply Credit Risk Modelling with the data they need to compile risk models. On one hand your duties will consist of technical aspects such as SAS/ SQL and Python programming, performing Data Quality analyses and integrating datasets. On the other hand you’ll be working on documentation and using your communicative skills for stakeholder alignment. You also play an active role in the frequent team meetings where knowledge-sharing and transparency on progress is key. Your working environment ABN AMRO Risk Data & Analytics (RD&A) is a rapidly growing team of which quantitative professionals form a large part. We are the bank’s expertise centre for the development of quantitative risk models. Our models support other entities of the bank in their day-to-day decision-making, from pricing deals and issuing customer loans to setting and monitoring market risk limits and defining the bank’s capital requirements.  The Modelling Data team is part of the Risk Data & Analytics department which is primarily responsible for supplying data for developing and calibrating risk models. The team is now being expanded to almost 50 FTE divided across 4 sub teams (Credit Risk Retail, Credit Risk Non-Retail, ALM and a team working on our Risk Analytics Platform).  In this role, you will be working in one of the Credit Risk Modelling Data teams (Credit Risk Retail or Credit Risk Non-Retail). These teams largely consist of highly motivated colleagues with international backgrounds, working in an open and informal atmosphere. Given the importance the regulatory authorities ascribe to modelling and the data underpinning it, this is a challenging and impactful role. Your profile Your ability and willingness to work with others is crucial for your success in this role. You are naturally someone who takes initiative, structures and organises work well and is keen to work with others to deliver tangible results. You are practical, have an analytical approach and good communication and presentation skills. You are a strong team player and you take responsibility for your work. In the dynamic environment in which you operate, you have the ability to get all stakeholders on board.  You also have the following qualifications and skills: experienced (5+ years) in working with data related to credit risk models a Master’s degree, preferably a beta study highly skilled in SQL, Python and PySpark, knowledge of SAS Enterprise Guide (SAS EG) and/ or Azure Databricks is an advantage the ability to detail and challenge data requirements knowledge of risk management in banking or financial institutions excellent verbal and written communications skills excellent stakeholder management skills What we offer we will give you the freedom to get the best out of yourself, work flexibly and have plenty of room to grow we help you to stay fit and healthy a job in pay scale 9 to 11, depending on your knowledge and experience a supplementary benefit budget of 11% with which you can buy flexible fringe benefits a personal development budget of € 1,000 a year an annual public transport season ticket a generous pension scheme Interested? If you are interested in this position, please apply via de apply button.  We look forward to meet you.  Employment agencies are requested not to reply to this vacancy.
